title: Ticket #1895: return code wrong from tools given -name with bad hostname
description:
It is difficult to script many CLI tools when they do not reliably return useful exit codes on errors. 

$ for t in condor_reschedule condor_vacate condor_off condor_on condor_reconfig condor_restart; do $t -name nohost; echo $?; done
condor_reschedule: unknown host nohost
0
condor_vacate: unknown host nohost
0
condor_off: unknown host nohost
0
condor_on: unknown host nohost
0
condor_reconfig: unknown host nohost
0
condor_restart: unknown host nohost
0

Better would be... 

$ for t in condor_reschedule condor_vacate condor_off condor_on condor_reconfig condor_restart; do $t -name nohost; echo $?; done
condor_reschedule: unknown host nohost
1
condor_vacate: unknown host nohost
1
condor_off: unknown host nohost
1
condor_on: unknown host nohost
1
condor_reconfig: unknown host nohost
1
condor_restart: unknown host nohost
1

In fact, since -name can be provided multiple times, if any fail a non-0 code should be returned.
